reviews.review: This is my go to game when I need some Brain Food. Community maps are some of the best I've ever seen.
很棒的游戏 单人玩的话剧情非常丰富和有趣 在玩乐之余还可以锻炼自己的逻辑思维能力 双人玩的话更是快乐翻倍 官方的关卡个人觉得有点简单 创意工坊的双人关卡和单人关卡都十分有趣 真的强烈推荐这个游戏
Still playable for a 3rd time decades(?) later!!!!
So good. Worthy sequel to my beloved Portal.

[h1]●▬▬▬◣ NOTE GLOBALE : 18/20 ◢▬▬▬●[/h1]


[h1] Avis détaillé [/h1]
Dans ses mécaniques autant que dans son écriture, Portal 2 est tout simplement brillant, intelligent et terriblement drôle. Un constat qui vaut aussi bien pour son mode solo que pour son mode coop qui convertira même les allergiques au multijoueur. Un titre résolument incontournable doté d'un gameplay sans cesse renouvelé et de répliques qui ne tarderont pas à devenir cultes.


[h1] Public conseillé [/h1]
❑ Je ne conseillerais pas ce jeu même à mon pire ennemi
❑ Les fans du genre ou de la franchise
❑ Les casual gamers
☑ Tout public
❑ Les hardcore gamers
❑ Les PGM sud-coréens


[h1] Graphismes [/h1]
❑ À vomir par terre
❑ Très mauvais
❑ Mauvais
❑ Corrects
☑ Très bons pour l'époque de sa sortie (2011)
❑ Beaux à en chialer


[h1] Qualité-prix [/h1]
❑ Complètement abusif
❑ Assez cher
❑ Raisonnable
☑ Pas très cher
❑ C’est donné


[h1] Configuration PC recommandée [/h1]
❑ L'ordi de ma grand mère
☑ Entrée de gamme
❑ Milieu de gamme
❑ Haut de gamme
❑ Un PC de la NASA


[h1] La prise en main [/h1]
❑ Nécessite l'implantation d'un nouveau bras
❑ Difficile
☑ Nécessite quelques heures
❑ Facile
❑ Inné


[h1] Durée de vie pour le finir à 100 % [/h1]
❑ Moins longtemps qu'une mouche
❑ Brève
❑ Plusieurs heures
☑ Une dizaine d’heures
❑ Plusieurs dizaines d'heures
❑ Une centaine d’heures
❑ Plusieurs centaines d'heures


[h1] Bugs [/h1]
❑ Le jeu est codé avec le cul
❑ Les bugs gênent le gameplay
❑ Les bugs ne gênent pas le gameplay mais sont présents
❑ Quelques bugs
☑ Le jeu est codé à la perfection (Aucun bug rencontré tout au long de mon aventure)


[h1] Avis général [/h1]
❑ N'y jouez surtout pas
❑ À vos risques et périls
❑ Jouez-y si vous avez assez d’argent
❑ Ne perdez pas plus de temps et jouez-y !
☑ Un must !

Just get it.

Seriously one of the best games I have ever played, and I grew up during the golden age of Super Nintendo and Sega Genesis.  (Quick note: spend time trying to get achievements in the first Portal game. I'll explain later.)

I'll try to keep this short.  Portal 2 continues the story of Portal, and I would argue that they are so intertwined that they are essentially one single game.  Two ways that Portal enhanced the experience of Portal 2 is that it gives you a sense of familiarity and attachment.  If you are like me and kept playing Portal just to get the achievements, you probably spent quite a bit of time trying to get those silly radios to work.  This has the effect of establishing a sense of comfort with familiar surroundings.  Portal 2 plays on that by first making it seem like you are repeating the same number of chambers (19).  When you get near the end, the game takes a turn.  I hope this isn't a spoiler, but the game changes the environment in which you play, you are no longer in the familiar test chambers, and the game lasts much MUCH longer than what you might have originally anticipated.  These episodes of displacement and discovery give Portal 2 a sense of bewilderment that is persistent throughout a large extent of the game.

As far as attachment goes, playing for the achievements in Portal extends the amount of time you interact with the antagonist, GLaDOS.  In Portal 2, this gives a sense of anxiousness as you anticipate a possible reunion with GLaDOS.  Later in the game, your history with GLaDOS is forever changed.  You are no longer interacting with the mechanical villain of the first game; you are now interacting with an unusual and vulnerable life form in an intimate manner.  You no longer are playing to keep your character alive, you are now playing to save others too.

I love games that engross the player and have them forget for a moment about the world they live in.  This game is fully engrossing.  Part of what gave me this feeling are the massive environments that the character passes through.  In this regard, Portal 2 reminds me of the imagery of the game Inside.  However, unlike Inside, you can explore part of the massive environments to a certain extent.  There are some challenges that require you to to leap, jump, transport, or traverse large distances.  And at times, you can see part of the area that you passed through a few challenges earlier.  This made me feel like I was on an adventure.  I fought very hard to move forward just a little, but every time I look back to the earlier arenas, I think to myself: "I can't believe I was able to get through that.  I must have what it takes to finish this game, so I'll just keep going."  Afterwards, each time I entered a new environment, I felt battle-hardened and said to myself: alright, let's do this!

I am guessing that an average player will not play for more than 3-4 hours each time, so this game is likely to last up to several days at least.  It might take a few players several weeks, which would only enhance the experience in my opinion.

I really loved this game, and I am genuinely sad I finished it.  However, I look forward to recommending it to other people, gamers and non-gamers alike.  It is a work of art and it's a shame that it's not as shareable as a movie or a show.  But I will use this game as an example to raise awareness of the need to include video games in our collective consciousness of what we deem to be art.
Portal 2 is literally my favorite game ever, i have never played anything better

Jesus, this game...
Where do I start... Maybe like this, I FUCKING LOVED IT, EVERY SECOND OF IT (yes, even the ones when I was confused as fuck and didn't know what to do) I LOVED IT.
I just finished playing the Half-Life games and decided I wanted to play the extension of the franchise, Portal.
And man, when I wonder if playing another game that is not made by Valve is worth it, I just get the answer right ahead, It isn't, I loved this game, and the first part of it, but this one was the cherry on top of the cake, which was a lie at first sight *wink wink*.
Get this game, or even better, get the Half-Life Complete Pack, you won't ever wonder if it was worth it! 
THE CAKE IS A LIE GUYS!

Казалось бы, обычная головоломка. А что будет, если примешать к этому хороший сюжет? Мы получаем эту замечательную игру!  Именно эта игра приучила меня к решению поставленной цели, а не бросание её на половине пути. с большим удовольствием играю в тестовые камеры мастерской steam. Если у вас есть лишние 600 рублей, и вы всё ещё не играли в Portal, не думая берите себе и своему другу. Почему своему другу? Так потому что, здесь просто чудесный кооперативный режим.
Я слишком тупой, для такой игры.

Portal 2 is nearly 10 years old. It's been almost 9 years since this game came out, and it is still a masterpiece. Age will never touch this game's gameplay or writing.
It's still fun.
It's still hilarious.
And it's still one of the best games of all time.
There's a reason this game is still rated overwhelmingly positive, because it's almost if not is a perfect game.
I stand by this being Valves best work.
Recomendo, Jogo 10/11 , é muito divertido o jogo, mas a unica coisa ruim é que depois de zerar o jogo inteiro não tem nada pra fazer, 5 estrelas
This has a great story and it is definitely something to play either to binge-game or even a great quarantine game!
